column3: Requirement
FUNCTIONAL
UAS shall determine autonomously how to navigate the aircraft to collect localization data on a RGV.
column7: Localize: Provide inertial estimate of RGV.

column3: UAS shall respond to flight operator inputs provided through a manual controller.
The aircraft shall take off from and land at a designated home base that is located at least 30 ft from the outer perimeter of the mission area.
UAS shall perform all autonomous motion within the designated mission environment in accordance with the CU FAA certificate of authorization (2023-WSA-13256-COA).
UAS shall provide its own power source and be untethered.
All sensor data shall be logged on-board the UAS with necessary data displayed on the ground UI.
SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
All UAS motion, besides takeoff and landing, shall stay within the operating environment
UAS shall perform all autonomous motion in a safe and controlled way.
UAS shall autonomously recognize when the mission has been completed.
UAS shall transition between mission phases.
UAS shall autonomously execute maneuvers to allow searching of the 150 x 150 ft environment.
UAS shall autonomously execute maneuvers to allow trailing, staying within 40 ft ground distance of acquired RGV ground targets.
UAS shall autonomously execute maneuvers that permit data collection for coarse RGV target localization.
UAS shall autonomously execute maneuvers that permit data collection for fine RGV target localization.
UAS shall autonomously execute maneuvers that permit data collection for joint RGV target localization.
UAS shall autonomously transmit the necessary information to the user via a ground UI.
UAS shall be able to initiate and disengage the autonomous flight via a ground UI.
The system shall be fully Robot Operating System (ROS) compatible.

column9: Use one of the senses to prove system meets requirements
Uses unit testing, modeling, and system knowledge

column3: UAS shall accommodate for the weight and size of the sensor payloads.
UAS shall provide necessary electrical power to all systems for a 15-minute flight.
UAS shall provide the necessary computational power for all operations during a 15-minute flight.
UAS shall provide the framework for manual flight.
UAS shall provide the framework for autonomous flight.
UAS shall have all necessary sensors to determine it's attitude and inertial position.
UAS shall be capable of transferring and recieving all necessary data to and from the ground station UI.
UAS shall be capable of storing data that will be accessible at the end of the flight.
UAS shall adhere to all relevant FAA and CU airworthiness regulations.
UAS shall display live aircraft states and desired RGV tracking artifacts to the operator at a ground control station through a UI.
UAS shall use an RGB camera as its primary sensor.
UAS shall have an onboard secondary sensor.
UAS shall be able to identify both RGVs and differentiate between them
UAS shall maintain mostly uninterrupted visual detection of a selected RGV target within its RGB camera sensor field of view when following an RGV.
UAS shall not communicate with RGVs.
UAS shall adhere to all FCC regulations.
SUB-SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
All motion planning shall include horizontal plane bounds on UAS movement so it stays within the 150 x 150 ft mission area.
All motion planning shall include vertical axis bounds on UAS movement so it stays between 30 and 60 ft.
UAS shall initiate the landing phase after mission completion.
UAS shall recognize when a height of 30-60 ft relative to the ground is reached during the takeoff phase and will begin searching for RGVs.
UAS shall recognize when an RGV has been acquired and will begin trailing the motion of the RGV.
UAS shall recognize when a tracked RGV stops its motion, characterized by a speed of 0 m/s, and will then begin acquisition of data for coarse localization.
UAS shall recognize when an RGV has gathered data for coarse localization for at least 60 seconds and will then begin acquisition of data for fine localization.
UAS shall recognize when all RGVs have had data gathered for fine localization for at least 30 seconds and will then begin acquisition of data for joint localization on all RGVs.
UAS shall recognize when all RGVs have had data gathered for joint localization for at least 20 seconds and will register as mission complete.
UAS shall perform a searching flight path maneuver to allow visual searching of the entire 150 x 150 ft environment.
UAS shall avoid to recognize any prior localized RGVs while searching, to ensure the UAS only acquires new RGVs.
UAS shall be able to follow RGV motion at speeds of up to 2 m/s.
UAS shall perform an orbiting flight path maneuver around the RGV to gather data for coarse localization within 2 meters
UAS shall perform an informative flight path maneuver to gather data for fine localization  1 meter
UAS shall perform an informative flight path maneuver to gather data for joint localization of RGVs within 1 meter
UI shall display a 2D map of the 150 ft x 150 ft environment.
UI shall display the current drone UAS location relative to the environment.
UI shall display an estimated state for acquired RGV location(s) at each stage of localization.
UI shall have the ability to initiate the UAS mission, beginning the startup sequence.
UI shall have the ability to activate a hover mode for the UAS, stopping all motion and mission operations until deactivated.
UI shall have the ability to abort the UAS mission, commanding the UAS to return to base and land.
UI shall be able to switch the UAS control method to a manual handheld controller, deactivating the autonomous controller.
UAS shall provide adequate structural support and impact absorption for hardware protection.
UAS shall be equipped with proper mounting solutions for sensors.
UAS shall have a battery that is capable of safely providing power to all systems throughout the entire flight.

UAS or ground station shall provide computational power that handles all computational requirements for drone 
operation.
Systems and motors shall be calibrated to provide specific movement given an input.
UI design shall allow for sending and recieving of signals to and from the UAS.
UAS shall be able to send and recieve all signals over any distance within the operational boundaries.
UAS shall weigh no more than 55 pounds.
UAS propellers must not interfere with eachother or the UAS itself. (AM 4.2.2.2 (b))
UAS transmitters and recievers shall have a diverse array of antennas. (AM 4.2.2.5 (b))
Ground station tansmitters and recievers shall have a diverse array of antennas. (AM 4.2.2.5 (b))
UAS shall be able to remain stable while in up to 10mph winds.
UAS shall be stable about all axes during operation.
All data collected during the mission shall be saved and made available for post processing.
Logged data shall be referenced to the aircraftâ€™s state at the time of recording.
An onboard communications link shall transmit telemetry and sensing data to the ground station during flight.
Data collected for coarse localization shall be acquired exclusively by the primary sensor's RGB sensing capability.
Data collected for fine localization shall be acquired exclusively by the seconday sensor.
Each RGV shall be identified during the course of the mission.
Each RGV shall be trailed during the course of the mission.
Each RGV shall have data acquired for coarse localization during the course of the mission.
Each RGV shall have data acquired for joint localization during the course of the mission.
Primary sensor shall provide sensing/tracking data to the ground station during operation.
Any beacons mounted to an RGV shall be passive or self-powered non-GNSS markers.
Any beacons mounted to an RGV shall be mounted before the mission and shall be removable after the mission.
All radio frequency transmission shall have a frequency within a permissible bandwidth as defined by the FCC (2.4 or 5 GHz).
Coarse localization data shall only come from the primary camera. (pixals and bounding box)
